name: src/fzp/bus.js
FZPBus
nodeMembers
description: Store the FZP node members as an array

name: setNodeMember
description: add a new node member if not exist

name: totalNodeMembers
description: Return the total number of nodeMembers

name: existModeMember
description: check if the given node member name does not exist at the nodeMembers array

name: src/fzp/connector-view.js
FZPConnectorView
src/fzp/connector.js
FZPConnector
examples:
const {FZPConnector} = require('fzp-js')

let connector = new FZPConnector({id: 'sample-id', name: 'sample-name'})
connector.type = 'sample-type'
connector.description = 'sample-description'
connector.views.breadboard.setLayer('sample-b-layer')
connector.views.breadboard.setSvgId('sample-b-svg')
connector.views.breadboard.setLegId('sample-b-leg')
connector.views.breadboard.setTerminalId('sample-b-terminal')

name: id
description: The id of the FZP connector.

name: name
description: The name of the FZP connector.

name: type
description: The type of the FZP connector

name: description
description: The description of the FZP connector

name: views
description:
The FZP connector views for breadboard, schematic and pcb.
Note that the pcb view has an object for copper0, copper1 etc.

name: src/fzp/fzp.js
FZP
description:
The FZP class is the main fzp data entry.
Here you can access the main data properties/objects and some utility functions
can be used to load svgs as string, count the total number of connections or set a connector.
examples:
const {FZP} = require('fzp-js')

let fzp = new FZP({moduleId: 'sample'})
fzp.version = '1.0.0'
fzp.setTag('demo')
fzp.setProperty('p', 'hello', true)
fzp.setView()
fzp.setConnector()
fzp.setBus()

name: constructor
description: FZP constructor has an opt argument object that can be used to setup data at the initialization.

name: views
description: The FZP views (icon, breadboard, schematic, pcb)

name: buses
description: The FZP buses is a map with instances of the Bus class.

name: totalTags
description: Get the total number of tags.

name: totalProperties
description: Get the total number of properties.

name: setProperty
description: Create or update a FZPProperty instance to the FZP.

name: getProperty
description: Get a FZP property by the given key.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the view can be 'breadboard', 'pcb', or 'schematic'

name: totalConnector
description: Get the total number of connector.

name: totalBuses
description: Get the total number of buses.

name: src/fzp/property.js
FZPProperty
examples:
const {FZPProperty} = require('fzp-js')

let property = new FZPProperty()

name: src/fzp/view.js
FZPView
description: FZPView class is used by the fzp breadboard, pcb and schematics view.
examples:
const {FZPView} = require('fzp-js')

let view = new FZPView()

name: totalLayerId
description: Get the total number of FZPView layer id's

name: setLayerId
description: Add a layer id to the FZPView

name: existLayerId
description: Check if a layer id exist at the FZPView layerIds array

name: loadSVG
description: load the svg of the image path from the fritzing-parts api

params.name: baseurl
params.description: the url to the fritzing-parts/core directory

name: src/index.js
src/utils.js
loadFZP
description: Load a FZP file from the given URL.

name: loadFZPandSVGs
description: Load a FZP and all linked SVGs

name: parseProperties
description: Get the parsed xml object and map to a proper structure

name: marshalToXML
description: Create a xml string of a FZP instance.

content:
# fzp-js [![](https://fritzing.github.io/fzp-js/badge.svg)](https://fritzing.github.io/fzp-js/)

The fritzing fzp javascript library is for processing fritzing fzp xml data.  
The Library can be used to load fzp's, parse and marshal to XML.


## Installation

Install the npm package
```sh
npm install fritzing/fzp-js --save
```

or use yarn to install and add the dependency to your `package.json`
```sh
yarn add fritzing/fzp-js
```


## Usage

Let's start with a simple szenario and load a fzp file and all svg's.  
Documentation of the library can be found [here](https://fritzing.github.io/fzp-js/)
```javascript
const {FZPUtils} = require('fzp-js')

const url = 'https://fritzing.github.io/fritzing-parts/core/LED-generic-3mm.fzp'
FZPUtils.loadFZP(url).then((fzp) => {
  console.log('FZP', fzp);

  // load the svg of the breadboard view
  fzp.views.breadboard.loadSVG('foo').then((d) => {
    console.log('SVG', d);
  }).catch((err) => {
    throw new Error(err)
  })

}).catch((e) => {
  throw new Error(err)
})
```


## Development
```sh
yarn install
make test
```

and lint your files before you commit
```sh
make lint
```

to build an es5 compatible version run
```sh
make build
```


## License
[MIT-LICENSE](LICENSE)
